title: Has Riot Fixed Syndra?
body: People were saying her stun wasn't working and how it didn't work in general o_O

replies.body: Her stun width's been increased in 5.2, so it should better match the visible size of the sphere. Feedback on how well that's matching up (whether it's about right, still too narrow, now too wide again) would be extremely useful - we'll continue tweaking in the next patch or two if that's still not right.

What about an 'edge case' scenario that resets the width but decrease stun depending on the accuracy of your aim, down to 0.1 sec on a mere graze shot, which is sufficient to cancel changeling abilities but also helps distinguish the good Syndra players from the Great.

Still hitting people, knocking them back, doing damage, but not stunning.  Sometimes it knocks back, but does no damage and doesn't stun.  It's really frustrating to hit a perfect Syndra stun and it not stun at all.

The stun is alright in lane (1v1) although I genuinely think there have been times the ball has glided past when I thought it should've stunned according to the animation. The hit box nerf hurt her teamfight quite a bit. Maybe remove the QoL arrow indicating the direction ("good vs great" Syndra argument), reduce the range so she has to invest a risk in such a powerful spell and buff the hit box. Idk.

lol I couldn't land my stuns after Syndra changes.

So I was forced to get better. Then I started landing them, except for the really bullshit ones, i.e. where you E them point blank with a sphere on top of them and they don't get stunned.

Now they fixed 90% of the those cases, though it still happens every now and then.
To be fair, it looks like the first one is the only one that bugged. The second one clearly missed Graves, the 3rd one stunned target, and the 4th clearly missed Irelia.
The third one stunned Graves but goes right through Morgana which allowed Morgana to then shield Graves to try and absorb some magic damage.
Yep, goes right through even giant targets and does nothing.
Her win rate is still like 42% so I'm inclined to say no, but I didn't notice anything in a couple of bots games I tried with her.

>
> Her win rate is still like 42% so I'm inclined to say no, but I didn't notice anything in a couple of bots games I tried with her.

Her winrate will remain bad indefinitely thanks to her Q nerfs.

Ive personally tested the change in a custom game for over 15 minutes and while thats hardly exhaustive i found no instances of a sphere not stunning when it clearly should have.
I still need to try in an actual game but she seems fixed so far.
Yes she is fixed as of 5.2 according to Pwyff.
